revision.text:
[[File:Soldiers during the Russian May 2011 Parade.jpeg|thumb|300px]] [[File:May 2011 Parade - beginning.jpeg|thumb|right|250px]] [[File:May 2011 Parade - troops.jpeg|thumb|250px]] [[File:May 2011 Parade - BTR-80.jpeg|thumb|250px|BTR-80]] [[File:May 2011 Parade - S-400.jpeg|thumb|250px|S-400]] [[File:May 2011 Parade - Topol-M.jpeg|thumb|250px|Topol-M]] [[File:May 2011 Parade - helicopters.jpeg|thumb|250px|Mi-8 helicopters]] The '''Moscow Victory Day Parade in Moscow''' was held on [[Victory Day (9 May)|9 May]], 2011 to commemorate the 66th anniversary of the [[German Instrument of Surrender|capitulation]] of [[Nazi Germany]] in 1945. The parade marked the [[Soviet Union]]'s victory in the [[Eastern Front (World War II)|Great Patriotic War]].
==Parade participants==
*20,000 soldiers and officers<ref name="RIA Novosti">{{cite web|url=http://en.rian.ru/infographics/20110505/163738950.html|publisher=[[RIA Novosti]]|accessdate=2011-05-07|title=2011 Victory Day Parade in Moscow}}</ref> representing all three services of the [[Armed Forces of the Russian Federation]], the [[Ministry of Internal Affairs (Russia)]], the [[Federal Security Service (Russia)]], and the [[Ministry of Emergency Situations (Russia)|Ministry of Emergency Situations]]. *1,500 [[marching band]] musicians<ref name="RIA Novosti"/> led by Lt. Gen. Valery Khalilov in his 9th Victory Day Parade appearance *+100 [[military vehicles]]<ref name="RIA Novosti"/> *5 [[Mil Mi-8 Hip]] [[helicopters]]<ref name="RIA Novosti"/> *Colonel General [[Valery Gerasimov]] – Deputy Chief of the Russian Armed Forces' General Staff<ref name="RIA Novosti"/> – Parade Commander *[[Anatoly Serdyukov]] – Minister of Defence of the Russian Federation – Parade Inspector
===Mobile Column=== *[[9A317]]<ref name="World Wide Defense">{{cite web|url=http://worldwide-defence.blogspot.com/2011/04/victory-day-parade-rehearsal-moscow.html|publisher=Military Defence and Technology|title=Victory day parade rehearsal Moscow 2011 |date=April 27, 2011|accessdate=2011-05-07}}</ref> *[[9A39M1]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[9A52-2 Smerch]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[T-72 variants|BREM-1]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[BTR-80]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[GAZ-2975]] Tigr<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[Pantsyr-S1]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[S-400]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[T-90|T-90A]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[Iskander-M]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[Iskander-M|9T250]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[KT-L]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[KET-T]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[2S19 Msta]]-S<ref name="World Wide Defense"/> *[[Topol-M]]<ref name="World Wide Defense"/>
===Air Column Flypast=== * [[Mil Mi-8 Hip]] Colors Party
